results.title: Peer culture
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores two worlds children must negotiate during middle childhood and adolescence; the authority of adults and the co-operation of peers. The nature of the peer group as a microsociety is analysed through a look at “los abandonados”, a homeless and parentless group of children in Guatemala City who live in a completely peer-organized world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Peer conducted behaviour modification (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Steven D McAdam and Phillip R. Blake
results.brief_description: Drs. Clement and Paterson discuss the roles of peers in child therapy. The film shows a program at the Oregon Institute which, having found that the child’s peers can undermine the work of both psychologists and parents, uses other children to reinforce the behaviour therapy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven D McAdam and Phillip R. Blake

results.title: Peculiar galaxies
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
This episode discusses a peculiar type of galaxy called a Quasar. Quasars looked liked stars but did not have the same size, shape or spectrum as stars. They were extremely luminous and expanding away from us. Quasars are believed to be the cause of galaxies. Astronomers believe that the structure of a Quasar is an extremely bright nucleus of a galaxy and a central Black Hole which over time evolves into a “normal” galaxy.

results.title: Pearls and savages (1921)
results.creator_credit: Frank Hurley and Stoll Film Co
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. After World War 1, having filled the position as the first official photographer of the Australian war effort, Hurley became interested in Papua New Guinea. In December 1920, he left Australia to record the work of Anglican missions in Papua and to make “travelogue entertainment”. The result was this documentary, “Pearls and Savages” which was released in Sydney, in December 1921.

results.title: Peace and voices in the wilderness
results.brief_description: One of man’s continuing problems is to reconcile the difference between what life is like and what it ought to be like. Shows the idyllic and essentially peaceful nature of life in the wilderness. Contrasts these scenes with sounds of riot, assassination, and other indications of man’s crimes against man in order to stimulate discussion on the effects of and solutions to some of society’s major problems.

results.title: Pay the piper
results.brief_description: A boy and a girl are killed on the eve of their graduation from high school. Anger takes the place of sorrow when their parents discover that alcohol was involved in the accident report. The film comes to a dramatic climax as the father realizes that it was liquor from his own home that killed his daughter and her companion.

results.title: Pay off in pain
results.brief_description: The personal and social tragedy of drug addiction with its evil accompaniment, drug traffic. Over the side of the silent liner in the darkness slips the package of smuggled narcotics, introducing us to the complex problem which involves all races and classes of man. We see many aspects of addiction - the addict prepearing an injection, a group waiting tensely for their dope peddler; agents preparing and adulterating the illegal product; the police catching a pedler red-handed. International and national authorities are working from two angles - suppression of the illicit traffic; and where possible, rehabilitation of the addict.

results.title: Pay as you go
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Pay As You Go (PAYG) system, introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on PAYG withholding and PAYG instalments and the requirements for business. Presented by Michael Caton.
